mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Microplitis Förster, 1862 (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from Iran

tp:treatment-sec.p: Body length 4.2 mm ; antenna as long as body, F15 length 2.0 × as long as its width; vertex punctate; notauli well defined with crowded rugosity; lateral and median lobe of anteromesoscutum weakly punctate and shiny; mesoscutellar disc anteriorly or antero-medially weakly punctate, shiny and its posterior area coriaceous ( Fig. 9C ); pterostigma length 2.1–2.2 × its width; vein R1 as long as pterostigma half; 1 st discal cell length 1.3 × its width; vein 1CUb 2.0 × as long as vein 1CUa ( Fig. 9D ); T1 rugulose, distinctly broadening posteriorly, its length equal or slightly longer than its maximum width; T2 weakly wrinkled; T3 and the following tergites smooth ( Fig. 9F ). Colour: body black; antenna brown; tegula and legs reddish yellow (except for black coxae); basal one quarter of pterostigma with a yellow spot.
